txt.en:
'Ah good, you have returned. You have my thanks for doing that for me. I...dislike those tasks and will be happy when the day comes when I can direct another to do such things. A true Horse-master has more to think of than delivering grain or mucking stalls.

'Now, though, to finish our agreement. You have done all that was asked of you, so now I will allow you to ride one of my tame mounts.

'Thank you again, and perhaps when you are more experienced, you can return and try to ride one of my father's mounts. Prepare yourself, though, my father won't let just anyone ride his steeds!'

'Well hello there! Without a word of direction, you come in and muck out one of my stalls. I never get that kind of service from Gaelm! Not that I need much help around here, but if he's trying to live up to the agreement his father put into place, he's not doing too good a job!\n\n'Oh well, perhaps that's something that's learned with time. Anyway, there's nothing else I have to do today, so if you want, you can head on back to Gaelm and tell him all the work is done!'
Stablehand's Hand

'So Gaelm got you to do deliver the grain, did he? He has a ways to go if he's going to be half the Horse-master his father is! Never seen a boy try to avoid the less \qpleasant\q tasks that go along with breeding horses as much as Gaelm.

'Oh well, if he fooled you into doing his work for him, who am I to complain? As long as the job gets done!

'So, now that you are here, you'll need to do something else for me. The stalls at both my stables and Bert Goldenleaf's down by the South-gate need mucking out. How about drawing some water from the Boar Fountain in town and taking care of that for me?'

'Good job. Normally I would ask Gaelm to muck out all the stalls, but seeing as you probably didn't know what you were getting into, one will be fine for now.\n\n'That's about all I need of you today, but Bert Goldenleaf's stalls are in about the same shape as mine. Why not go and give them the same treatment? Draw some water from the Boar Fountain and use it on one of Bert Goldenleaf's stalls.'
You have failed to bring the grain to Bill Rosewood
'If you wish to ride one of my steeds, you must do some tasks for the Stable-masters of Bree. Your first task is to take a sack of grain down to Bill Rosewood at the stables near the West-gate.'
You have failed to bring water to Bill Rosewood's stalls
'You should do whatever Bill Rosewood would ask of you. Remember that in exchange for this, I will grant you the boon of riding one of my horses.'
You have mucked out one of Bill Rosewood's stalls

The sack of grain is near the silo on Hengstacer's Farm, east of Gaelm.\n\nGaelm has instructed you to pick up a sack of grain near the silo at Hengstacer Farm and bring it to Bill Rosewood, the Stable-master near the West-gate of Bree.
'If you wish to ride one of my steeds, you must do some tasks for the Stable-masters of Bree. Do as Bill Rosewood asked and muck out one of his stalls.'
You have failed to bring water to Bert Goldenleaf's stalls
Bill Rosewood is at the stables near the West-gate of Bree, to the south of the Hengstacer Farm.\n\nYou should speak with Bill Rosewood at his stable.
'If you to wish ride one of my steeds, you must do all that the Stable-masters of Bree ask of you. Bill Rosewood by the West-gate of Bree may have more work for you before you are done.'
You have mucked out one of Bert Goldenleaf's stalls

The Boar Fountain is south of The Prancing Pony Inn in Bree.\n\nBill Rosewood has asked you to draw water from the Boar Fountain in Bree and use it to muck out one of his stalls by the West-gate of Bree.

'If you wish ride one of my steeds, you must do all that the Stable-masters of Bree would ask of you, and that includes tasks for Bert Goldenleaf. I would do as Bill Rosewood directed and muck out Bert's stalls.'

Bill Rosewood is at the stable near the South-gate of Bree.\n\nYou mucked out one of Bill Rosewood's stalls, but he mentioned that Bert Goldenleaf, who maintains the stalls by the South-gate of Bree, may need the same service. You should speak with Bill Rosewood again before you leave.
'If you wish ride one of my steeds, you must do all that the Stable-masters of Bree ask of you. Although Bill Rosewood has nothing else for you to do, Bert Goldenleaf may still have tasks for you.'

The Boar Fountain is south of The Prancing Pony Inn in Bree. Bert Goldenleaf is at the stable near Bree's South-gate.\n\nBill Rosewood told you to draw some water from the Boar Fountain in Bree and use it to muck out one of Bert Goldenleaf's stalls.
'Well, if you are doing Gaelm's work, you'd best get to it. Draw some water from the Boar Fountain here in town and use it to muck out the stalls.'
'There's nothing else here for you to do, but Bert Goldenleaf will need some of your help. Go ahead and draw more water from the Boar Fountain and use it to muck out one of his stalls.'
Bert Goldenleaf is at his stable near the South-gate of Bree.\n\nYou should speak with Bert Goldenleaf to see if there is anything else he would ask of you.

'Well, I'm glad to hear you mucked out one of Bert's stalls, but did you ask him if there was anything else he might need? Old Bert is a hard worker, so I doubt there's much that he needs done, but if you are doing Gaelm's tasks, you should ask!'

Return to Gaelm at the Hengstacer Farm in the Bree-fields, north of Bree.\n\nYou have done all that the Stable-masters of Bree have asked of you. Now you can return to Gaelm and see if he will allow you to ride one of his tame mounts.
Pick up a sack of grain
Bring the sack of grain to Bill Rosewood
Draw water from the Boar Fountain
Bring the water to one of Bill Rosewood's stalls
Draw water from the Boar Fountain
Bring the water to one of Bert Goldenleaf's stalls
Talk to Gaelm

Gaelm has told you that in exchange for doing tasks for the Stable-masters of Bree, he will grant you the boon of being able to ride one of his steeds. Although lacking the power and stamina of his father's horses, Gaelm's horses are more tame and easier to ride.

'Have you come seeking a steed of your own? I may be able to help you. My father is teaching me to become a Horse-master in my own right someday, but currently the horses I breed lack the stamina his possess. However, they are more tame than my father's horses, so you should be able to ride one, if you so wish.

'I will grant you this boon, though, only in exchange for helping me. My father has made an arrangement with the Stable-masters of Bree. Instead of refunding their money for horses that have proven unusable in their trade, he has offered to do work for them. These tasks usually fall to me, but if you do some of these tasks for me, I will allow you to ride one of my steeds.

'The first task is to bring a sack of grain to Bill Rosewood at the stables near the West-gate of Bree. The grain is over to the east, by the silo.'
